snippet: The United States Supreme Court today left intact a 1990 initiative limiting the terms of California State officeholders, thereby giving a shot of adrenaline to similar measures under consideration in at least 16 states.   "What happened today wil...
lead_paragraph: The United States Supreme Court today left intact a 1990 initiative limiting the terms of California State officeholders, thereby giving a shot of adrenaline to similar measures under consideration in at least 16 states. "What happened today will give momentum again to the term-limit folks, who lost it after the Washington election," said Bill Frenzel, a retired Minnesota Congressman and a guest scholar at the Brookings Institution, referring to the lone electoral defeat for a term-limits measure, in Washington State last fall. "They will take heart and be encouraged to work harder."

headline.main: Court's Ruling On Terms Gives Boost to Backers
